Woven Nylon band review

Apr 8, 2016

I bought the new nylon strap for the Apple Watch when it was announced, partly because I love my watch still, and partly because it was pretty cheap for a watch band at Â£39. Iâ€™ve been wearing it since it arrived, just over a week ago, so here are my thoughts so far.

Look

I chose the gold/red colour band, since I already owned the turquoise sport band and wanted something that would look noticeably different. The red and yellow lines make the strap look a warm brown from a distance, which has a nice effect. I particularly like the fact that the inside of the band has the colouring of the Gold/Royal Blue strap. This isnâ€™t something you can see when the watch is on, but itâ€™s a nice little touch. The main thing I dislike is the hard plastic connectors used to slot the strap into the watchâ€Šâ€”â€Šthey feel cheap, though what can you expect for the price.

Feel

The strap is basically comfortable on the wrist, though it isnâ€™t as smooth as the sport band, or as perfectly form-fitting as the Milanese loop. Iâ€™d be perfectly happy to wear this strap all of the time if it were the only one I owned, but itâ€™s unlikely to replace my other straps day to day. In terms of how difficult it is to put on, Iâ€™d rate it easier than the sport band, but harder than the Milanese. The other thing I have to mention is that the strap has already started to deform slightly in the time Iâ€™ve been wearing it. Not a deal-breaker, but something to keep in mind.

Wrap-up

This is a good strap, which I liked with some caveats. Iâ€™d recommend this strap to somebody who owns an Apple Watch with another strap, but if youâ€™re buying a new watch, youâ€™re probably better off getting the sport band to start with. Itâ€™s more comfortable, looks very nice, and is more durable.
